issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description: [~mingma] pointed out in the review discussion for MAPREDUCE-5465 that the NM is currently sending out of band heartbeats only when stopContainer is called.  In addition those heartbeats might be sent too early because the container kill event is asynchronously posted then the heartbeat monitor is notified.
fields.summary: Out of band heartbeats are sent only on container kill and possibly too early

comments.body: We should consider sending out of band heartbeats after a container completes rather than when a container is killed.  For a cluster running MapReduce this should be almost equivalent in terms of number of OOB heartbeats sent since the MR AM always kills completed task attempts until MAPREDUCE-5465 is addressed.

In the patch, the container asks NodeStatusUpdater to send out of band heartbeats when it exits. The definition of "exit" also includes special cases where the container is killed before it is launched. This allows RM to know about completed containers via out of band heartbeats under different scenarios.

Thanks for updating the patch!  Looks good to me overall.

Now that we're passing the context, seems like we could avoid passing the state store and simply retrieve it from the context.  There might be other parameters that could also be derived from the context, but that would be a simple one to help avoid adding yet another parameter.
Thanks [~jlowe]! Here is the updated patch with your suggestion.
